PHRASE.LANG: Van Hamersveld recalls, ‘The Skull Tongue started with a trademark I was drawing for the Grateful Dead manager "Rock Skully" in the early 70s, then Warner Brothers wanted an ad for the Deads new single for the trades’. The Skull Tongue image is hooked up to the ‘Skeletons From The Closet’ album cover. [#Legal]

Van Hamersveld se souvient : 'au début des années 70, "The Skull Tongue" était le logo que j'avais dessiné pour le manager de Grateful Dead, "Rock Skully", et plus tard, Warner Brothers a réclamé une pub pour leur nouveau single'. L'image Skull Tongue est associée à la pochette de l'album "Skeletons From The Closet". [#Legal]

Van Hamersveld erinnert sich: „‚The Skull Tongue’ begann als Logo, das ich für den Manager von Grateful Dead, ‚Rock Scully’, in den frühen 70ern gezeichnet hatte. Warner Brothers wollte dann ein Motiv für die neue Single. Das "Skull Tongue"-Bild ist verwandt mit dem ‚Skeletons From The Closet’-Albumcover.“. [#Legal]

Van Hamersveld ricorda di aver cominciato a pensare al "teschio con la lingua" quando stava disegnando un marchio per il manager dei Grateful Dead "Rock Skully" all'inizio degli anni '70; poi la Warner Brothers lo volle in una pubblicità per mettere in commercio il nuovo singolo. L'immagine del Teschio con la lingua è legata alla copertina dell'album "Skeletons From The Closet". [#Legal]

Van Hamersveld recuerda: "La calavera sacando la lengua nació con un logotipo que estaba dibujando para el mánager de Grateful Dead, Rock Skully, a principios de los 70. Por aquel entonces Warner Brothers quería un reclamo comercial para el nuevo single”. La calavera sacando la lengua pertenece a la portada del álbum “Skeletons From The Closet”. [#Legal]

Van Hamersveld recalls, ‘The Skull Tongue started with a trademark I was drawing for the Grateful Dead manager "Rock Skully" in the early 70s, then Warner Brothers wanted an ad for the Deads new single for the trades’. The Skull Tongue image is hooked up to the ‘Skeletons From The Closet’ album cover. [#Legal]
